about.description:
DIRAC (Distributed Infrastructure with Remote Agent Control) INTERWARE is a
software framework for distributed computing providing a complete solution
to one or more user community requiring access to distributed resources.
DIRAC builds a layer between the users and the resources offering a common
interface to a number of heterogeneous providers, integrating them in a
seamless manner, providing interoperability, at the same time as an
optimized, transparent and reliable usage of the resources.

DIRAC has been started by the LHCb collaboration who still maintains it. It
is now used by several communities (AKA VO=Virtual Organizations) for their
distributed computing workflows.
about.summary: DIRAC is an interware, meaning a software framework for distributed computing.

about.description:
DIRAC (Distributed Infrastructure with Remote Agent Control) INTERWARE is a
software framework for distributed computing providing a complete solution
to one or more user community requiring access to distributed resources.
DIRAC builds a layer between the users and the resources offering a common
interface to a number of heterogeneous providers, integrating them in a
seamless manner, providing interoperability, at the same time as an
optimized, transparent and reliable usage of the resources.

DIRAC has been started by the LHCb collaboration who still maintains it. It
is now used by several communities (AKA VO=Virtual Organizations) for their
distributed computing workflows.
about.summary: DIRAC is an interware, meaning a software framework for distributed computing.

name: dirac-grid

new_version_errors.7r1:
The recipe did not change in the version migration, a URL did not hash, or there is jinja2 syntax the bot cannot handle!

Please check the URLs in your recipe with version '7r1' to make sure they exist!

We also found the following errors:

 - could not hash URL template 'https://github.com/DIRACGrid/DIRAC/archive/v{{ major }}r{{ minor }}p{{ patch }}.tar.gz'

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "dirac-grid" %}
{% set version = "7.3.23" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/D/DIRAC/DIRAC-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: aa62800d7950fba1381846f3f4449f7c9e495553206874bafbe9e1734e7c418a

  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python >=3.9
    - setuptools-scm
  run:
    - boto3
    - botocore
    - cachetools
    - certifi
    - diraccfg
    # Not yet updated for Python 3 
    # - fts3-rest
    - future
    - importlib_resources
    - python-gfal2
    - m2crypto >=0.36,!=0.38.0
    - pexpect
    - prompt-toolkit >=3
    - psutil
    - pyasn1
    - pyasn1-modules
    - pyparsing
    - python >=3.9
    - python-dateutil
    - pytz
    - requests
    - setuptools
    - six
    - sqlalchemy
    - subprocess32
    - voms

test:
  imports:
    - DIRAC
    - DIRAC.AccountingSystem
  commands:
    # Requires fts3 which isn't released with Python 3 compat :(

about:
  home: https://github.com/DIRACGrid/DIRAC/
  summary: DIRAC is an interware, meaning a software framework for distributed computing.
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  license_file: LICENSE
  description: |
    DIRAC (Distributed Infrastructure with Remote Agent Control) INTERWARE is a
    software framework for distributed computing providing a complete solution
    to one or more user community requiring access to distributed resources.
    DIRAC builds a layer between the users and the resources offering a common
    interface to a number of heterogeneous providers, integrating them in a
    seamless manner, providing interoperability, at the same time as an
    optimized, transparent and reliable usage of the resources.

    DIRAC has been started by the LHCb collaboration who still maintains it. It
    is now used by several communities (AKA VO=Virtual Organizations) for their
    distributed computing workflows.
  doc_url: https://dirac.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/DIRACGrid/DIRAC/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - chrisburr
